DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A classification of adverse event data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: A classification of adverse event data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the category of the a
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the category of the adverse event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the adverse event category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.

DataElement.changeDescription: 6.8.21 Released to support CDISC CDE metrics clean-up. mc 2/18/20 tmt transferred ownership from NRDS to NCI Standards/BMaeske and restored CSIs. 11-26-19 tmt removed NCI CSI, associated with NRDS CSI and changed Registration Status. 11-25-19 tmt transferred ownership from NCI Standards to NRDS/BMaeske. 8/1/18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt.
